Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Unstable or unreliable caregiving; fear that close others will leave.
Symptoms: Intense fear of loss, clinginess or avoidance in relationships, jealousy, emotional volatility.
Element Links: Connection (attachment worry), Roots (parent absence/loss), Stability (world anxiety)

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Abuse, betrayal, or manipulation by caregivers/others.
Symptoms: Expectation of harm/deception, hypervigilance, difficulty trusting, may test or provoke others.
Element Links: Roots (abuse/trauma items), Connection (trust difficulty), Environment (safety concerns)

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Lack of nurturance, empathy, or affection from caregivers.
Symptoms: Belief no one will meet emotional needs, loneliness, difficulty asking for support, choosing depriving partners.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Criticism, rejection, or shaming; feeling inherently flawed.
Symptoms: Deep shame, self-loathing, hypersensitivity to criticism, hiding "defects", self-sabotage in relationships.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Feeling different or excluded from family/peers.
Symptoms: Sense of being outsider, avoidance of groups despite longing, feeling no one understands.
Element Links: Connection (outsider feelings), Environment (spaces/personal identity), Digital Wellbeing (comparison)

Symptoms: Belief one is incapable, excessive reliance on others, avoidance of responsibility, helplessness.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Over-involved caregivers; no separate identity encouraged.
Symptoms: Lack of individual direction, guilt when separate, fusion with others' emotions/needs.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Criticism or comparison leading to belief in inevitable failure.
Symptoms: Avoidance of challenges, self-sabotage, underachievement despite ability.
Belief one is superior, demands special treatment, lack of empathy/reciprocal responsibility.
Difficulty tolerating frustration, impulsivity, avoidance of discomfort needed for goals.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Punishment for asserting needs; dominance in family.
Symptoms: Suppression of anger/needs to avoid retaliation, passive compliance, bottled resentment.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Guilt or modeling of excessive giving.
Symptoms: Over-focus on others' needs, neglect own, resentment, burnout.
Excessive need for admiration, identity based on external validation, conformity.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Focus on negative in family; repeated hardship.
Symptoms: Chronic focus on negatives, worry, discounting positives, life feels bleak.

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): Suppression of emotions shamed or punished.
Symptoms: Restraint of feelings, fear of losing control, appear rigid/cold, difficulty with spontaneity.
Element Links: Connection (hiding feelings), Digital Wellbeing (curating self), Vitality (mood)

Root (Childhood Unmet Need): High pressure for performance; criticism for imperfection.
Symptoms: Perfectionism, chronic dissatisfaction, burnout, harsh self/other judgment.
Self-punishing or punitive toward others, difficulty forgiving errors.
